titlestmt.titleproper: National Bureau of Standards circular letters 1914-1949
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.unittitle: National Bureau of Standards circular letters

bioghist.p: Founded in 1901, the National Institute of Standards and Technology (formerly the Bureau of Standards) is a non-regulatory federal agency within the U.S. Commerce Department's Technology Administration. NIST's mission is to promote U.S. innovation and industrial competitiveness by advancing measurement science, standards, and technology in ways that enhance economic security and improve our quality of life.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of two volumes of technologic papers, 1914-1916, and letter circulars (1916-1920 and 1935-1949). The circulars include technical reports, lists of publications available from the Bureau, and bibliographies.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
